answers.question: Telegram Handle We Can Use To Contact You
Link to your Public Group Chat

answers.answer:
Participation in multiple Gitcoin Grants rounds, with continued community support:

- https://checker.gitcoin.co/public/project/show/stereum-ethereum-node-installer-manager
- https://checker.gitcoin.co/public/project/show/stereum-ethereum-node-installer-manager-1
answers.question: Have you participated in a previous Gitcoin Grants Round? If so, please name the rounds or link the builder profile to prior rounds.

answers.answer:
While we don‚Äôt track users or collect any personal data, the community impact speaks for itself:

- Over 40,000 downloads of the Stereum launcher to date: https://hanadigital.github.io/grev/?user=stereum-dev&repo=ethereum-node

- More than 45,000 Ethereum mainnet validators currently run with ‚Äústereum‚Äù in their graffiti tag: https://beaconcha.in/charts/graffiti_wordcloud
answers.question: How does your project contribute significantly to the Ethereum network's infrastructure? Please provide specific examples and metrics if available.

answers.answer: With Stereum, running a node is as easy as three clicks and about five minutes. By dramatically lowering the technical barrier, we enable more users to run their own Ethereum and Gnosis nodes, participate in protocols like SSV Network or Lido CSM, or launch their own DVT clusters. Stereum is entirely GUI-based‚Äîno command line required‚Äîmaking self-sovereign infrastructure accessible to a much broader audience.
answers.question: Describe any pioneering development work in your project, particularly in enhancing privacy, interoperability, or user experience.

answers.answer:
Setting up an Ethereum node and its associated protocols is time-consuming and especially challenging for beginners. Stereum addresses this by providing a free, open-source tool that can run on any server‚Äîwhether local, cloud-based, or in a virtual machine‚Äîgiving users full control over their infrastructure without requiring deep technical expertise.

Our core focus is on managing the node itself. Since we actively use Stereum in our own node operations on our own infrastructure, the tool is battle-tested and continuously improved based on real-world needs - making it the go-to solution for many in the staking and node management space.
answers.question: What specific problems or challenges in the Ethereum ecosystem does your project address? How does your solution improve upon existing alternatives?

answers.answer: Looking ahead, we‚Äôre working to further improve the experience for developers by building a Data Access Management Hub for Ethereum and Gnosis nodes, and integrating various Layer 2 networks directly into the Stereum launcher.
answers.question: Outline your project's roadmap and how the grant funds will be used to achieve your development goals.

answers.answer: More staking nodes mean more decentralization. By making node operation accessible, we‚Äôve helped a large number of nontechnical users get started with running their own nodes. Beyond the tool itself, we actively support our community through our Discord server‚Äîoffering guidance, troubleshooting help, and answering any questions users might have. With Stereum, they‚Äôre never alone in their journey toward self-sovereignty.
answers.question: How does your project contribute to the decentralization and security of the Ethereum network?

answers.answer: We don‚Äôt deploy any smart contracts‚Äîbut if you‚Äôd like to support our development of Stereum directly, you can always donate to: [Ethereum Mainnet] stereum.eth
answers.question: For any project deploying smart contracts on blockchain networks, please list all your deployer addresses and their corresponding blockchain networks. Use this format for each entry: [deployer_address], [chain_id]‚Äîfor example, 0x123abc..., 42161 (This represents a deployer address on the Arbitrum network). Please include a separate line for each unique deployer address and blockchain combination.

project.title: Stereum - Ethereum Node Installer & Manager
project.description:
Stereum is an open-source Ethereum Node Setup designed to widen access to Ethereum by simplifying the process of setting up and managing nodes. Built to support the setup, configuration, and ongoing maintenance of Ethereum nodes, Stereum provides an intuitive, GUI-based interface that ensures anyone‚Äîfrom beginners to experienced operators‚Äîcan contribute to the network‚Äôs strength and decentralization.

üí° Why Support Stereum?
Donations to Stereum fuel the development of innovative features and enhancements, making the Ethereum ecosystem more accessible, secure, and inclusive. Your contributions go toward building and improving key features such as:

- Streamlined Node Setup: One-click installation and configuration makes running a node fast and easy‚Äîeven for nontechnical users. Automatic updates keep Ethereum clients, the OS, and the Stereum launcher current with minimal effort.
- Advanced Configuration Capabilities: Fine-tune your node setup with custom options for execution and consensus clients, network selection, MEV-Boost, Web3Signer, archive modes, and more.
- Diverse Client & Network Support: Stereum supports all major Ethereum clients‚ÄîGeth, Erigon, Nethermind, Besu, Reth on the execution side, and Prysm, Lighthouse, Nimbus, Teku, Lodestar, and Grandine for consensus. You can run on Ethereum mainnet, Goerli, Holesky, Sepolia, Gnosis, and even set up local devnets.
- Robust Staking & Validator Management: Easily manage validator keys, monitor staking performance, initiate exits or withdrawals, and benefit from built-in protections like slashing prevention and doppelg√§nger checks‚Äîall through a simple UI.
- Cutting-Edge DVT & Protocol Integration: Launch Distributed Validator Technology (DVT) clusters with one click for protocols like SSV Network and Lido CSM. Integrate MEV-Boost to maximize validator rewards.
- Enhanced Security: Stereum operations run over secure SSH tunnels to limit attack surfaces. Regular updates, security patches, and client diversity options improve both resilience and safety.
- Monitoring & Alerting: Preconfigured Prometheus + Grafana dashboards provide real-time data on node health, sync status, validator performance, and system metrics. Mobile alerts via the Node Monitor app keep you informed of missed duties or downtime.
- User-Centric Design: From SSH terminal access and multi-language support to encrypted config exports and server migrations, Stereum is built for ease of use without sacrificing power or flexibility.
- Community & Support: Our active Discord server is home to a global community where we answer questions, provide support, and gather feedback directly from users. Stereum also supports multiple languages to help onboard users worldwide.

By supporting Stereum, you're investing in Ethereum's decentralized infrastructure. Your donation helps us continue to remove technical barriers, increase network resilience, and empower more people to participate in Ethereum‚Äôs future‚Äîfrom home stakers to advanced operators.

üçÑ Project Website: stereum.net
üî® GitHub: stereum-dev/ethereum-node
üí¨ Discord: Join the Community
üì∞ Twitter: @stereumdev
üì∫ YouTube: Stereum on YouTube
